path_get_point_speed.htm+html.head.title: path_get_point_speed.htm+html.body.p:87-3
path_get_point_speed: With this function you can get the speed of the point (as defined in the Path Editor or when you dynamically add a path point using path_add_point()) expressed as a percentage. So, if you have a path point set to 50 in the path editor, this function would return 50 when used.

path_get_point_speed.htm+html.head.title: path_get_point_speed.htm+html.body.table.tbody.tr.td:100-9
path_get_point_speed: The index of the path to check.

path_get_point_speed.htm+html.head.title: path_get_point_speed.htm+html.body.p:116-3
path_get_point_speed: The above code checks the path point "0" of the path indexed by "pth_Patrol" to see if the speed is not equal to 100. If it is not then it sets the speed of that point to 100.
